options.label: A

options.text: You should eat outside-in when using utensils.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Red shift for objects moving away from us

title: Equality, sports, and Title IX - Erin Buzuvis and Kristine Newhall

multiple-choice.question: When was the law called Title IX passed by Congress?
What percentage of college athletes were women in 1972?    - A: 25%
According to Title IX, what are the three tests to demonstrate fairness in opportunities for girls?    - A: Equality, fairness, and justice
What does the proportionality test require?    - A: That girls receive the same number of athletic opportunities as boys

options.label: B
options.text: That girls receive the same percentage of athletic opportunities as the percentage of girls in the student body

options.label: C
options.text: That boys receive more athletic opportunities than girls

options.label: D
options.text: That girls receive fewer athletic opportunities than boys

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the progress test?    - A: To increase the number of boys participating in sports

options.label: B
options.text: To make up for the days when girls had fewer opportunities by adding new sports for girls on a regular basis

options.label: C
options.text: To reduce the number of girls participating in sports

multiple-choice.question: What does the satisfied interests test require?    - A: That girls receive the same number of athletic opportunities as boys

options.label: B
options.text: That schools regularly ask female students what sports they are interested in and take into consideration the popularity of certain sports in the area

options.label: C
options.text: That boys receive more athletic opportunities than girls

options.label: D
options.text: That girls receive fewer athletic opportunities than boys

multiple-choice.question: According to Title IX, what are some examples of equal quality opportunities for boys and girls teams?    - A: Equipment, supplies, publicity, scheduling of games and practice times, and quality and number of coaches

options.label: B
options.text: Locker rooms, practice spaces, and competitive facilities, as well as medical services

options.label: C
options.text: Only boys teams should have equal quality opportunities

options.label: D
options.text: Only girls teams should have equal quality opportunities

multiple-choice.question: What is the Office of Civil Rights responsible for?    - A: To make sure schools comply with Title IX

options.label: B
options.text: To reduce the number of girls participating in sports

options.label: D
options.text: To increase the number of boys participating in sports

multiple-choice.question: What can you do if you think there might be inequality in your school?    - A: Nothing, it's not your problem

options.label: B
options.text: Approach a school administrator, a parent, or the Office of Civil Rights

options.label: C
options.text: Ignore it and hope it goes away

options.label: D
options.text: Complain to your friends and family

multiple-choice.question: Why is equality important in sports?    - A: So that boys can dominate

options.label: C
options.text: So that everyone can participate and have equal opportunities

options.label: D
options.text: So that schools can save money

title: The punishable perils of plagiarism - Melissa Huseman D'Annunzio

What is the result of presenting a paper that is made up of passage upon passage of other people's ideas as one's own work?

options.label: D
options.text: To make people aware of the consequences of plagiarism

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
